Operation 'getProductsWithLatestProductFiles' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is vague ('Latest Files' is unclear). Description lacks clarity about the one-to-one file relationship and doesn't explain the use case. Improved version clarifies the bulk data context, explains the file relationship, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation for product discovery.

data.current_summary: Returns all products with Latest Files.
data.current_description: Use this GET to retrieve latest released bulk data products. Note that there is one file per product. The response includes product fields such as title, description, frequency, and level.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all bulk data products with latest files
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all available bulk data products with their latest released files. Each product is associated with exactly one file. Returns product metadata including title, description, update frequency, and hierarchical level. Useful for discovering the complete product catalog with current data.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague ('Latest Files' is unclear). Description lacks clarity about the one-to-one file relationship and doesn't explain the use case. Improved version clarifies the bulk data context, explains the file relationship, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation for product discovery.

message: Operation 'getProductsByName' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original summary is overly technical and unclear about the search capability. Description is poorly organized with default values scattered without clear structure. Improved version clarifies the search functionality, consolidates date defaults into a coherent explanation, and helps AI agents understand both the search behavior and optional filtering capabilities.

data.current_summary: Returns files associated with products (of level PRODUCT) based on their full or partial names.
data.current_description:
Use this GET to search for bulk data services by product name or description. An error message will be returned if the product cannot be found by name. Note that product name is not case sensitive. You can enter full or partial name of an existing product to receive bulk data services. Default values for field names are as follows
- if both years are not defined, toYear will be set equal to current year, fromYear will be set equal to previous year
- if fromYear is defined, toYear will be set equal to fromYear+1
- if fromMonth not defined, current month will be used
- if toMonth not defined, it will be set equal to fromMonth
- if fromDay is not defined, it will be set equal to current day (today)
- if toDay is not defined, it will be set to the last day of toMonth/toYear
data.summary_suggestion: Search bulk data products by name or partial name
data.description_suggestion: Searches for bulk data products by full or partial product name (case-insensitive). Returns product files and metadata for matching products at the PRODUCT level. Supports optional date range filtering (fromYear, fromMonth, fromDay, toYear, toMonth, toDay). If date parameters are omitted, defaults are applied: toYear defaults to current year, fromYear to previous year; if only fromYear is specified, toYear becomes fromYear+1; month defaults to current month; day defaults to today. Returns error if no products match the search criteria.
data.reasoning: Original summary is overly technical and unclear about the search capability. Description is poorly organized with default values scattered without clear structure. Improved version clarifies the search functionality, consolidates date defaults into a coherent explanation, and helps AI agents understand both the search behavior and optional filtering capabilities.

message: Operation 'getProductsTree' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate. Description has redundant statements and lacks clarity about the complete tree structure and use cases. Improved version eliminates duplication, clarifies that it returns the complete hierarchy, and better explains the role of short names in the API ecosystem for AI agent navigation.

data.current_description:
Use this GET to retrieve short name and parent/child relationships for bulk data products. Short names are unique IDs of the products and should be used in other GETs where {shortName} parameter is required
Use this GET to perform initial exploration of the existing products hierarchy
Short names are unique IDs of the products and should be used in other GETs where {shortName} parameter is required
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the complete hierarchical tree of all bulk data products with their parent-child relationships. Returns short names (unique product identifiers) and structural hierarchy information. Short names are required parameters for other product retrieval operations. Useful for initial product catalog exploration and understanding product organization. No parameters required.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description has redundant statements and lacks clarity about the complete tree structure and use cases. Improved version eliminates duplication, clarifies that it returns the complete hierarchy, and better explains the role of short names in the API ecosystem for AI agent navigation.

message: Operation 'getProductSubTree' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is vague about the action (what does 'hierarchical subtree' mean to an AI agent?). Description is wordy and uses unclear comparisons ('almost like'). Improved version clarifies the action (retrieve subtree), specifies the input requirement (short name), explains the output (product node and children), and helps AI agents understand when to use this versus the full tree operation.

data.current_description: Use this GET to search for bulk data products by their short names. This works almost like products/tree GET, the difference is that it returns subtree data starting from a particular tree node (i.e. the GET returns all children if parent short name is entered). If a product cannot be found by its short name (has to be exact match and is not case sensitive), then an error message will appear in response body.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve product subtree by short name
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the hierarchical subtree for a specified bulk data product using its short name. Returns the product node and all its child products with parent-child relationships. Short name matching is case-insensitive but requires exact match. Returns error if the specified short name is not found. Useful for exploring product families and related products within the hierarchy.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague about the action (what does 'hierarchical subtree' mean to an AI agent?). Description is wordy and uses unclear comparisons ('almost like'). Improved version clarifies the action (retrieve subtree), specifies the input requirement (short name), explains the output (product node and children), and helps AI agents understand when to use this versus the full tree operation.

message: Operation 'getProductsByShortName' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify the search capability. Description is unclear about date input options and references external documentation instead of being self-contained. Improved version clarifies the search action, explains both date input methods with priority rules, and consolidates information for better AI agent understanding without external references.

data.current_summary: Returns products along with their associated files by short names.
data.current_description:
Use this GET to search for bulk data products by their short names and description. Note that "From" and "To" dates can be inputted separately as year/month/day values or as a single date string in format "YYYY-MM-DD".
If all values are entered, single date strings have a higher priority
For the list of default values rules, see GET /products/byname/{productName} above
data.summary_suggestion: Search bulk data products and files by short name
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves bulk data products and their associated files by product short name. Supports optional date range filtering using either separate year/month/day parameters or a single date string in YYYY-MM-DD format. When both formats are provided, date string format takes priority. Applies default date values if parameters are omitted (see /products/byname/{productName} for default rules). Returns product metadata and associated files matching the specified short name.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify the search capability. Description is unclear about date input options and references external documentation instead of being self-contained. Improved version clarifies the search action, explains both date input methods with priority rules, and consolidates information for better AI agent understanding without external references.

message: Operation 'getLatestProductFilesByProductIdAndTime' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary doesn't clarify the year-based filtering. Description lacks clarity about what 'latest within the year' means and doesn't explain the use case. Improved version specifies both required inputs (short name and year), clarifies the filtering behavior, explains the practical use case, and helps AI agents understand when to use this versus other product retrieval operations.

data.current_summary: Returns products along with their latest files by short names.
data.current_description: Use this GET to search for latest released bulk data products by their short names and release year. The return response will include the latest files within the year specified.  An error message will be returned if product(s) cannot be found for the year specified
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve latest product files by short name and year
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the latest released bulk data files for a specified product (by short name) within a specified year. Returns product metadata and the most recent files released during that year. Useful for accessing current data for a specific product without retrieving historical versions. Returns error if the product is not found or if no files exist for the specified year.
data.reasoning: Original summary doesn't clarify the year-based filtering. Description lacks clarity about what 'latest within the year' means and doesn't explain the use case. Improved version specifies both required inputs (short name and year), clarifies the filtering behavior, explains the practical use case, and helps AI agents understand when to use this versus other product retrieval operations.
